title: American_Top_40_1985_September_21st
description:
"YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re hearing the nationÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s forty biggest hits. This is American Top 40. My name's Casey Kasem and our countdown to the number one song in the land continues."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

As of this broadcast:

There is one female artist who has her seventh top ten single on the chart. She is only one top ten hit away from tying Connie Francis and Donna Summer who each have eight.

Casey tells how the single biggest selling record of the rock and roll era was only a B-side release.

Casey answers the question, "What recording artist has had the longest span of time between top ten hits?" Both hits were flying-saucer records.

"There Must Be An Angel" by the Eurythmics is at number 22 and features a harmonica solo by Stevie Wonder who has a song at number 24.

Casey tells about the 1969 world series and how the Mets prevailed in five games after a miserable eight-year existence.
